metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11049 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In FreeRDP after 1.1 and before 2.0.0, there is an out-of-bound read of client memory that is then passed on to the protocol parser. This has been patched in 2.0.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libuwac0-0 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
winpr-utils - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> included in same commit as CVE-2020-11048

criterions.comment: freerdp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
freerdp2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
